content: Good for you! And you’re right — you won’t change your mind. (I speak from experience). Many people seem convinced from childhood with the certainty that they want kids, will have them, and that life would be hopeless and bleak without them. I truly do hope they have those children, because they’re who SHOULD have them. Everyone who doesn’t feel that way? Not so much. I wouldn’t tell people my particular stance on children unless they inquire with massive, persistent rudeness. It’s actually nobody’s business. Back in the 70s, there were a spate of books by women who either had kids and kind of regretted it or didn’t want kids and took a lot of flack for it. (Look at the public library or Amazon for Ellen Peck and Shirley Radl). Mindless pressure to have kids, I assure you, is far from new.
